"Daniel Sullivan's production is thrilling. In a stroke of casting genius, Laura Linney and Cynthia Nixon alternate in the Regina and Birdie roles at different performances. You can see both â€” and you should...What struck me hardest is how rounded these characters are...The best part? Both women characters are too strong to be merely victims. This is a compelling play about power and its abuses...It's also a complex character study. This is one you shouldn't miss."
